headline: Action Figure Toys Market to Reach US$ 11.15 Billion by 2033 | Astute Analytica
summary: Action figure toys market thrives on licensed hero media, appealing to both nostalgic adult collectors and discerning parents seeking developmental, safe products. Silicon's versatility and medium-priced segments drive sales, though digital entertainment and supply chain complexities pose challenges for sustained growth.Chicago, Aug. 27, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The global action figure toys market was valued at US$ 7.4 billion in 2024 and is expected to reach US$ 11.15 billion by 2033, growing

headline: Helped by brand tie-ups, Lego's first-half sales hit a record
summary: STORY: Lego's first-half sales hit a new record.The Danish toymaker announced Wednesday sales rose 12% during the period to $5.43 billion.Partnerships with other major brands like Formula One and Jurassic Park helped it outperform rivals.Operating profit for the first six months was also up by a tenth to almost $425 million.CEO Niels Christiansen said, "The toy market is actually back to growth this year, but we are outpacing it and taking market share."Lego reported growth across all its markets, including China, where it has faced challenges in recent years.U.S. sales also grew at double-digit rates.Christiansen said Lego hadn't seen a significant trend for U.S. customers to trade down to cheaper products - despite economic uncertainties related to trade tensions.He added the company had managed tariff impacts.Lego's peers, including Hasbro and Barbie-maker Mattel, are more exposed to tariff volatility due to their reliance on Chinese manufacturing.
